flawed_nl_solution:
20% of $45 is (1/5)*$45 = $<<(1/5)*45=9>>9
The price of the textbook in other bookshops cost $9 less than $45 which is $45-$9 = $<<45-9=63>>63
Three textbooks from the school bookshop would cost $45*3 = $<<45*3=135>>135
Three textbooks from another bookshop would cost $63*3 = $<<63*3=189>>189
Peter can save $135-$189 = $<<135-189=-54>>-54 by buying from another bookshop

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 36, not 63. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
